Package org.microbean.jersey.netty

Provides classes and interfaces for integrating Jersey into Netty.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ByteBufQueue
    An interface indicating that implementations can add a ByteBuf to themselves.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter<T>
    A partial ContainerResponseWriter implementation that is aware of Netty constructs.
    ByteBufChunkedInput
    A FunctionalByteBufChunkedInput that reads from a ByteBuf.
    EventLoopPinnedByteBufInputStream
    A ByteBufQueue and an InputStream that reads from a (possibly mutating and expanding) CompositeByteBuf, ensuring that all operations occur only on the Netty event loop thread.
    EventLoopPinnedByteBufOutputStream
    An OutputStream that writes to a ByteBuf on Netty's event loop.
    FunctionalByteBufChunkedInput<T>
    A ChunkedInput implementation that uses a Function to read from a ByteBuf and return a relevant chunk of its data.
    Http2ContainerResponseWriter
    An AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter that works with Http2HeadersFrame-typed request objects.
    HttpContainerResponseWriter
    An AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter that works with HttpRequest-typed request objects.
    JerseyChannelInboundHandler
    A SimpleChannelInboundHandler that adapts Jersey to Netty.
    JerseyChannelInitializer
    A ChannelInitializer that sets up Jersey integration.
    SecurityContextAdapter
    A fallback SecurityContext implementation that provides no user Principal, has no role or user database, is not secure, and that does not require authentication.
    SimpleContainer
    A straightforward Container implementation that is not actually needed for Jersey integration.

Package org.microbean.jersey.netty Description

Provides classes and interfaces for integrating Jersey into Netty.
Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
JerseyChannelInitializer
